Package org.anchoranalysis.image.object

Class LabelObjects

Object
LabelObjects
public class LabelObjects
extends Object
Writes a unique ID (successive integer IDs) for each object's voxels into a channel, and 0 for background.
Author:
Owen Feehan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    LabelObjects()  
    LabelObjects​(Optional<java.util.function.UnaryOperator<ObjectMask>> operationBeforeLabelling, Optional<java.util.function.Consumer<OverlappingObject>> overlappingObjectConsumer)  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    Channel createLabelledChannelForObjects​(ObjectsWithBoundingBox objects, Optional<Map<Integer,​ObjectMask>> mapLabels)
    Creates a channel that is exactly the same-size as the bounding-box around a collection of objects, and labels the background with 0, and each object in the collection with an incrementing unique integer identifier
    void labelObjectsInChannel​(Channel channel, ObjectCollection objects, Optional<Map<Integer,​ObjectMask>> mapLabels)
    Replaces the contents of the channel so that all objects voxels are labelled with successive unique integer identifiers 1,2,3 etc.

    • LabelObjects

      public LabelObjects()

  • Method Details

    • createLabelledChannelForObjects

      public Channel createLabelledChannelForObjects​(ObjectsWithBoundingBox objects, Optional<Map<Integer,​ObjectMask>> mapLabels) throws CreateException
      Creates a channel that is exactly the same-size as the bounding-box around a collection of objects, and labels the background with 0, and each object in the collection with an incrementing unique integer identifier
      Parameters:
      objects - the objects to write IDs for
      mapLabels - if set, an entry is added for every labelled object from object (unscaled) to the label it is assigned
      Returns:
      a channel of the same-size as the bounding-box associated with objects and with unique IDs for each object, and 0 for voxels not on any object
      Throws:
      CreateException

    • labelObjectsInChannel

      public void labelObjectsInChannel​(Channel channel, ObjectCollection objects, Optional<Map<Integer,​ObjectMask>> mapLabels) throws CreateException
      Replaces the contents of the channel so that all objects voxels are labelled with successive unique integer identifiers 1,2,3 etc. and voxels in no object are 0.
      Parameters:
      channel - the channel whose voxels will be replaced
      objects - the objects to write IDs for
      mapLabels - if set, an entry is added for every labelled object from object (unscaled) to the label it is assigned
      Throws:
      CreateException
